word_mean: inertia-gravity wave  在重力和科里奥利力共同作用下产生的大气波动。
生态系统对外部的干扰, 如风、火、食草动物及病虫害的数量剧增等干扰时，仍能保持干扰前的状态。

sentence.Network_en: I can't seem to throw off this feeling of inertia.
sentence.Network_cn: 我好像无法摆脱这种无力的感觉。

sentence.Network_en: We had a feeling of inertia in the afternoon.
Inertia carried the plane onto the ground.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent. (in sense 2): from Latin, from iners, inert- (see inert)

entry.def: If you have a feeling of inertia, you feel very lazy and unwilling to move or be active.

example.ex: This might help you overcome inertia.
example.tran: 这可能有助于你克服惰性。

entry.def: Inertia is the tendency of a physical object to remain still or to continue moving, unless a force is applied to it.

means.word_mean: 1. a disposition to remain inactive or inert;

sentences.sentence: "he had to overcome his inertia and get back to work"

means.word_mean: 2. (physics) the tendency of a body to maintain is state of rest or uniform motion unless acted upon by an external force
